sentences: Mehed lõid kannud kokku ja jõid õlut.
Enne vagunisse ronimist võiks siiski mõned kannud teha.
context: The word 'õlut' is the partitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'õlu', which means 'beer'. In Estonian grammar, the partitive case indicates incomplete action or partial object. So when you say 'õlut', you're referring to some amount of beer (as in drinking it, having it, etc.) rather than referring to beer as a general concept.
